# Welcome {.unnumbered}

Welcome to this hands-on guide to setting up your environment and connecting to SQL Server databases using Python.

What you will achieve:

1. Prepare your operating system and developer tools.
2. Install the Microsoft SQL Server ODBC drivers and command-line utilities.
3. Configure VS Code so you can browse databases and run scripts comfortably.
4. Use Python, `SQLAlchemy`, and `pandas` to connect, query, and explore data.


::: {.callout-tip}
Along the way you will learn why each tool matters, how to verify every step, and where to look when something goes wrong.
:::
